item.title: A New Chapter: SD-Routing's Revolution in Network Management
item.description:
Introduction

Software Defined Networks (SDNs) came with the promise of simplifying network management, enabling network teams to automate and adopt a programmatic approach. Cisco created solutions like - Catalyst Center, ACI, Meraki and Viptela SD-WAN. The latter introduced new controllers that changed the rules that dictate how the network operates.

Organization that were not ready to take the full SD-WAN leap, while still desiring the benefits of SDN principles had limited options, such as integrating with third-party systems or relying on Catalyst Center. While these solutions addressed some challenges, a significant gap remained unfilled until… SD-Routing!
